sub-heading: NASIK: A woman pilgrim was killed and 27 others injured in three separate Road accidents near Vani, about 50 km from here on Sunday, police said on Monday.

heading: Five killed in road mishaps in 24 hours
sub-heading: NEW DELHI: Five persons died in separate Road accidents on Sunday. A Faridabad resident, Satish Sharma, was killed when the Toyota Qualis he was travelling in hit a broken-down truck in Civil Lines area on Sunday.

heading: Maharashtra govt asked to explain steps to prevent accidents
sub-heading: MUMBAI: Mumbai high court has directed the Maharashtra government to enumerate in an affidavit what steps would it take to reduce Road accidents in the state and whether it was feasible to strictly implement compulsory wearing of helmets by those riding two wheelers.

heading: Five SBI employees killed in road mishap
sub-heading: PALANPUR: Five employees of the State Bank of India were killed and five others injured in a Road accident near Malvan village, 14 km from here on Saturday afternoon, the police said.

heading: Hospitals' quick-fix scheme for mishap victims
sub-heading: PUNE: In view of the increasing number of fatal accidents on national highways, citybased Sancheti hospital is planning to start a pre-hospital care, trauma and disaster management training project, 'Saving Lives', in the city.

heading: Realtor guilty of killing wife
sub-heading: A south Delhi property dealer, who plotted the murder of his wife barely four months after their marriage, and the hired shooter he roped in for the purpose were convicted by a Delhi court.

heading: 2 teenagers killed in hit-and-run
sub-heading: BANGALORE: An Army officer's teenaged daughter and son were killed in a Road accident near Ulsoor lake on Saturday afternoon. They were knocked down by an Army truck, according to the police.

heading: 4 killed in van-lorry collision
sub-heading: HYDERABAD: Four persons died, while another suffered injuries in a Road accident at Bata Singaram village on the city outskirts on Wednesday morning.

heading: Three killed in road mishaps
sub-heading: CALCUTTA: In a spate of Road accidents, two women and a man were killed and three persons were injured in different parts of Calcuta on Tuesday. Two middle aged women who were waiting at the roadside to cross the road near Thakurpukur 3A bus stand, were knocked down by a 119 route mini bus. They died on the spot.

heading: Mobike looted; 2 killed
sub-heading: PATNA: Three criminals snatched a Hero Honda motorcycle (BR-1S-3559) from its owner, Ganga Prasad, near Tedhi-Pul under the Fatuha police station on late Saturday night. According to informed sources, acting swiftly the local police caught hold of one of the criminals, Devi Sharan, who was fleeing with the motorcycle.

heading: Mother of two killed in city for dowry
sub-heading: LUCKNOW: Mithilesh Kumari, 32, mother of two children, was allegedly burnt to death by her inlaws on Saturday.

heading: 5 more fatal accidents, police look for pattern
sub-heading: NEW DELHI: Two hit-and-run cases among five fatal accidents reported since Saturday have given the traffic police another reason to study the pattern of such mishaps.

heading: Senior cop's guard killed
sub-heading: The victim, Jaibahadur (26), was found lying in a pool of blood at the ACP R Ashok's compound on Borewell Road early on Friday.

heading: 24 injured in different incidents
sub-heading: 24 persons, were injured in separate incidents taken place at various places in Vaishali district on Tuesday and Wednesday.

heading: In Panchkula, 50 hurt in brawls, 17 in accidents
sub-heading: PANCHKULA: Drunken brawls among slumdwellers and accidents kept the general hospital staff, Sector 16, and policemen busy throughout the day on Sunday.

heading: Teacher injured in fan collapse
sub-heading: KOLKATA: There was commotion at the Lake Girls' School in South Kolkata's Vivekananda Park area on Thursday morning when a wall fan suddenly fell on the head of teacher Mou Chakraborty, 34, who lost consciousness and was hospitalised.

heading: George hurt in road mishap
sub-heading: PATNA: Defence minister George Fernandes sustained minor injuries in a Road accident in Nalanda district in the wee hours of Wednesday.

heading: 27 accident-prone spots identified
sub-heading: The traffic police have identified as many as 27 new `black spots' or accident-prone areas, after studying the places where accidents have taken place more than twice.

heading: Murder convict dies in mishap
sub-heading: KHARAR: One of the four convicts in the murder of former Akali Dal MLA Bachittar Singh was on Sunday killed a car accident on Kharar-Ludhiana Highway near here.

heading: 21 killed in UP in separate accidents
sub-heading: The most serious mishap was reported from Ghaziabad where 11 persons were killed in a head on collision between two trucks on Sunday morning.

heading: Teenager gets lifer for killing advocate
sub-heading: MANGALORE: First Additional Judge A.V. Chandrashekar on Friday sentenced Sudhakar Poojary (19) to life imprisonment in connection with the murder of a notary advocate -- Kushal G. Hegde -- in Kundapur last year.

heading: 7 injured in Thane hall blast
sub-heading: Seven persons were injured when a crude bomb exploded in the parking area of Gadkari Rangayatan, a landmark auditorium near the Masunda lake, on Wednesday evening.

heading: Missing girl found dead in Aarey
sub-heading: The body of a 14-year-old girl from Andheri, who was missing from home for three days, was found in the interiors of Aarey Colony.

heading: Students go berserk in Hamirpur, 1 killed
sub-heading: LUCKNOW: Death of a degree college student in a Road accident sparked off violence in Hamirpur on Friday morning. Infuriated students resorted to heavy stone-pelting and arson, leaving half-a-dozen policemen injured.

heading: Faster cars = more accidents?
sub-heading: PUNE: Will the rising presence of faster, powerful cars on Indian roads mean more accidents and fatalities of innocent victims?

heading: 4 killed, 15 hurt in two mishaps
sub-heading: PUNE: Four people were killed and 15 injured in two separate Road accidents in the city. According to the Chatushrungi police, one Shivaji Tupe (55) died on the spot when the driver of the Tata Sumo in which he was travelling plunged into a ditch at Sutarwadi on the Katraj-Dehu Road bypass around 2.30 pm.

heading: Yet another AMTS bus accident sends shockwaves
sub-heading: Trouble erupted on the Nehru Bridge late on Wednesday night. It all began with an Road accident at 10.15 pm when Aras Kadri, 18, was run over by an AMTS bus.

heading: 3 pedestrians among 5 killed in accidents
sub-heading: NEW DELHI: Five persons, including three pedestrians, were killed in Road accidents in different parts of the city in the last 48 hours.

heading: Govt official abducted, killed over posting
sub-heading: AHMEDABAD: A deputy mamlatdar posted in tribal dominated Meghraj taluka of Sabarkantha district in North Gujarat met a gory end on Monday evening when the widow of his colleague, who was killed in an accident on Thursday, along with several other villagers abducted and killed him.

heading: Seven of family killed in accident
Police grapple with jam after accidents
sub-heading: HYDERABAD: Picture this: A Road accident. At least a dozen people huddle around the victim and the smashed cars.

heading: Some relief for mishap victims
sub-heading: Called the Solatium Fund, it was introduced by the Central government in 1989 as per the provisions of the Motor Vehicles Act to provide compensation to the victims of hit-and-run motor accidents.

heading: Road mishaps kill more than cancer
sub-heading: Number of fatalities down but road mishaps claim more lives than deadly diseases

heading: 3 dead, 2 injured in five accidents
sub-heading: Three men lost their lives while two others were injured in five different Road accidents in the past 24 hours.

heading: 7 killed in road mishap
sub-heading: HAJIPUR: In a major Road accident, at least seven persons, including two women, died and 21 others, including a two-year-old girl, were seriously injured on Sunday night at Bilath Chowk under the Chandpura police outpost in Vaishali district.

heading: Crimefile: Fatal accidents
sub-heading: HYDERABAD: Three persons died in separate Road accidents in the city in the past 24 hours.

heading: Rapid rescue units for accidents launched
sub-heading: PUNE: Former cricketer and test captain Dilip Vengsarkar on Monday inaugurated the much-awaited two-wheeler rapid rescue units at the Lokmanya Medical Foundation Hospital at Pimpri.

heading: West Ahmedabad more mishap-prone
sub-heading: AHMEDABAD: Old Ahmedabad on the eastern banks of the Sabarmati may be infamous for suffocating traffic jams and narrow, congested roads.

heading: Former MP Haroobhai killed in accident
sub-heading: AHMEDABAD: Noted lawyer-activist and former MP Haroobhai Mehta was killed in a Road accident near Bhavnagar on Saturday night. Mehta was going to Bhavnagar when his Maruti Esteem crashed into the rear of a truck that had suffered a breakdown on the highway around 9 pm.

heading: Anand Dighe dead, Sainiks set hospital on fire
sub-heading: THANE: Senior Shiv Sena leader and district unit chief of party Anand Dighe died in a private hospital here on Sunday night following a massive heart attack. He was 50.

heading: Youth dies from head injury in Agra
sub-heading: AGRA: Even while renowned neurosurgeons of the country debated in a top hotel here on how to provide swift attention to victims of brain injury, a young man, returning home after serving dinner to them, was knocked by a speeding vehicle and died for want of attention from a neurosurgeon just outside the hotel.

heading: State plans accident insurance cover
sub-heading: KOLKATA: The state government has finally shown some sensitivity. A day after transport minister Subhas Chakraborty dismissed the horrifying tragedy at Bijan Setu as a 'mere accident', the administration has pulled out an insurance plan.

heading: Heart Brigade extends aid to mishap victims
sub-heading: PUNE: Have you ever felt helpless and confused at the sight of a serious accident? Has the fear of the ensuing medical and legal complications put you in the common dilemma - to help or not to help?

heading: Three out of four accident victims in city without pavements are pedestrians
sub-heading: MUMBAI: Activists have expressed hope that the Salman Khan case will be the catalyst for a tougher motor law. Lawyers say one reason why the obsolete Section 304 A of the Indian Penal Code has not been changed is because the rich benefit from its leniency.
